links.english: "Funny. Funny sailor jokes." She nods, without smiling. "Sorry if I'm not laughing out loud, but the comedy has worn thin over the years."
links.polish: „Zabawne. Zabawne żeglarskie żarty” – kiwa głową, ale się nie śmieje. „Wybaczy pan, że się nie śmieję, ale przestało mnie to bawić wiele lat temu”.
links.belarusian: "Смешна. Смешныя марскія жарты", — ківае галавой, але не смяецца. "Выбачайце, што я не смяюся, але гэта перастала мяне забаўляць шмат гадоў таму".

links.title: Empathy: "Great, now you reminded her of the..."
links.english: Great, now you reminded her of the husband.
links.polish: Świetnie. Przypomniałeś jej o mężu.
links.belarusian: Цудоўна. Ты нагадаў ёй пра мужа.

links.title: Suggestion: "It's okay, she just hasn't figured..."
links.english: It's okay, she just hasn't figured out how these things work between the sexes. Keep at it. She'll come around.
links.polish: Nic nie szkodzi, po prostu nie rozumie jeszcze, jak się załatwia takie międzypłciowe sprawy. Trzymaj tak dalej. W końcu pojmie.
links.belarusian: Нічога страшнага, проста ён яшчэ не разумее, як вырашаць такія міжполавыя справы. Так трымай. Нарэшце зразумее.

links.title: You: ""Since the dawn of mankind, Al-Gul..."
links.english: "Since the dawn of mankind, Al-Gul has watched over the re-procreation of our species. Lay with me. Let's celebrate the Gul."
links.polish: „Od samych początków ludzkości Al Gul sprawował opiekę nad rozmnażaniem się naszych gatunków. Chodźmy, połóżmy się razem na posłaniu. Uczcijmy Gul”.
links.belarusian: "Ад самага пачатку чалавецтва Аль Гул даглядаў размнажэнне нашага роду. Пойдзем, ляжам разам на ложку. Ушануем Гул".

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Now there's a whole shipment of bi..."
links.english: "Now there's a whole shipment of big words." She looks at you from head to toe. "May mankind be plentiful, I guess? Can I get back to my nets now?"
links.polish: „Wypowiedział pan mnóstwo wielkich słów” – stwierdza, mierząc cię wzrokiem od góry do dołu. „Niechaj ludzkość będzie liczna. Mogę już wrócić do swoich sieci?”
links.belarusian: "Вы сказалі шмат вялікіх слоў", — адзначае, аглядаючы вас ад галавы да ног. "Няхай чалавецтва будзе мноства. Можа, я ўжо вярнуся да сваіх сетак?"

links.title: Suggestion: "She doesn't even *understand* you a..."
links.english: She doesn't even *understand* you asked her out. Perhaps you're too sober to pull it off right now? Try again later.
links.polish: *Nie rozumie* nawet, że ją zaprosiłeś na randkę. Może jesteś zbyt trzeźwy, żeby to teraz ogarnąć? Spróbuj lepiej później.
links.belarusian: *Не разумее* нават, што ты запрасіў яе на спатканне. Можа, ты занадта цвярозы, каб зразумець гэта зараз? Паспрабуй лепш пазней.

links.title: You: ""Alcohol makes closeness possible...."
links.english: "Alcohol makes closeness possible. Let's *connect*."
links.polish: „Alkohol umożliwia bliskość. *Połączmy się*”.
links.belarusian: "Алкаголь дазваляе блізкасць. *Аб'яднаемся*".

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Alcohol? Connect? I'm not sure I'm..."
links.english: "Alcohol? Connect? I'm not sure I'm following you." There's confusion in her eyes.
links.polish: „Alkohol? Połączmy się? Chyba nie do końca pana rozumiem” – jej oczy zdradzają dezorientację.
links.belarusian: "Алкаголь? Злучымся? Напэўна, я не да канца вас разумею", — яе вочы выдаюць разгубленасць.

links.title: You: ""Get hammered with me. On a date. D..."
links.english: "Get hammered with me. On a date. Drunk-date. It will be nice, I promise."
links.polish: „Niech się pani ze mną sponiewiera. Na randce. Pijackiej randce. Będzie miło, obiecuję”.
links.belarusian: "Няхай спадарыня паняўчыць са мной. На спатканні. На вясёлым спатканні. Будзе прыемна, абяцаю".

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: "She bursts out laughing. "That's a..."
links.english: She bursts out laughing. "That's a good impression. You really crack me up, officer. Now how can I help you?"
links.polish: Wybucha śmiechem. „Świetna parodia. Naprawdę potrafi mnie pan rozśmieszyć. W czym mogę panu pomóc?”
links.belarusian: Узрываецца смехам. "Выдатная пародыя. Сапраўды можаце мяне рассмяшыць. Чым магу вам дапамагчы?"

links.title: You: ""Be seeing you." [Leave.]"
links.english: "Be seeing you." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Do zobaczenia”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Да сустрэчы". [Адысці].

dialogueTree.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Aye, the sea's gonna calm down soo..."
dialogueTree.english: "Aye, the sea's gonna calm down soon. I can feel it. The wind is turning southeast." She nods. "What's on your mind, officer?"
dialogueTree.polish: „Tak, morze niedługo się uspokoi. Czuję to. Wiatr zaczyna wiać z południowego wschodu” – kiwa głową. „W czym mogę pomóc, funkcjonariuszu?”
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Так, мора неўзабаве супакоіцца. Адчуваю гэта. Вецер пачынае дзьмуць з паўднёвага ўсходу", — ківае галавой. "Чым магу дапамагчы, афіцэр?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "Why does she care about the waves s..."
links.english: Why does she care about the waves so much?
links.polish: Czemu tak bardzo obchodzą ją fale?
links.belarusian: Чаму яе так моцна цікавіць хвалі?

links.title: You: ""What is it with you and those wave..."
links.english: "What is it with you and those waves?"
links.polish: „Co pani tak ciągle z tymi falami?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму вы ўвесь час пра гэтыя хвалі?"

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""What is it with waves and fisherme..."
links.english: "What is it with waves and fishermen?" She tilts her head and looks at the sea. "We need to be out there, with them. Fishing, making a living. So I ask them to accommodate me."
links.polish: „Co łączy fale i rybaków?” – pyta, przekrzywiając głowę, i spogląda na morze. „Musimy być tam z nimi. Łowiąc, zarabiając na życie. Więc proszę je, aby miały mnie na względzie”.
links.belarusian: "Што аб'ядноўвае хвалі і рыбаловаў?" — спытвае, нахіліўшы галаву, і глядзіць на мора. "Мы павінны быць там з імі. Лаўлючы, зарабляючы на жыццё. Таму прашу іх мець мяне на ўвазе".

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""But until that happens I can try t..."
links.english: "But until that happens I can try to assist you the best I can," she adds with a smile. "So, what will it be, officer?"
links.polish: „Ale zanim do tego dojdzie, mogę panu pomóc” – dodaje z uśmiechem. „Więc co chce pan wiedzieć?”
links.belarusian: "Але перад тым як гэта здарыцца, я магу вам дапамагчы", — дадае з усмешкай. "Дык што вы хочаце ведаць?"

links.title: You: "Nevermind the waves. Let's stay on..."
links.english: Nevermind the waves. Let's stay on track here.
links.polish: Zapomnij o falach. Trzymajmy się tematu.
links.belarusian: Забудзь пра хвалі. Давай трымацца тэмы.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Of course. Question time!"
links.english: Of course. Question time!
links.polish: Oczywiście. Czas na pytania!
links.belarusian: Вядома. Час для пытанняў!

dialogueTree.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""The waves are beginning to die dow..."
dialogueTree.english: "The waves are beginning to die down... look at those little bastards. Simmer down. Simmer down, bastards."
dialogueTree.polish: „Fale zaczynają słabnąć... Niech pan spojrzy na te draństwa. Uspokójcie się. Uspokójcie się, dranie”.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Хвалі пачынаюць слабець... Глядзіце на гэтыя потвары. Супакойцеся. Супакойцеся, пачвары".

dialogueTree.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Aye, the sea's gonna calm down soo..."
dialogueTree.english: "Aye, the sea's gonna calm down soon. I can feel it. The wind is turning southeast." She nods. "What's on your mind, officer?"
dialogueTree.polish: „Tak, morze niedługo się uspokoi. Czuję to. Wiatr zaczyna wiać z południowego wschodu” – kiwa głową. „W czym mogę pomóc, funkcjonariuszu?”
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Так, мора неўзабаве супакоіцца. Я гэта адчуваю. Вецер пачынае дзьмуць з паўднёвага ўсходу", — ківае галавой. "Чым я магу дапамагчы, афіцэр?"

dialogueTree.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Officer Harry... you're wounded. W..."
dialogueTree.english: "Officer Harry... you're wounded. Why are you wounded? You look terrible."
dialogueTree.polish: „Funkcjonariusz Harry... Jest pan ranny. Dlaczego jest pan ranny? Wygląda pan paskudnie”.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Афіцэр Гары... Вы паранены. Чаму вы паранены? Выглядаеце жахліва".

links.title: Conceptualization: "You're not *limping*. You're *you*."
links.english: You're not *limping*. You're *you*.
links.polish: W ogóle nie *kulejesz*. Jesteś po prostu *sobą*.
links.belarusian: Ты зусім не *хромаеш*. Ты проста *сабой*.

links.title: Authority: "She sounds almost disappointed with..."
links.english: She sounds almost disappointed with you. *Reprimanding* you for falling and hurting your knee.
links.polish: Jej ton jest niemal pełen rozczarowania tobą. Udziela ci *reprymendy* za to, że się przewróciłeś i uszkodziłeś sobie kolano.
links.belarusian: Яе тон амаль поўны расчаравання табой. Яна дае табе *вымаўленне* за тое, што ты зваліўся і пашкодзіў сабе калена.

links.title: You: ""You seem angry. Why?""
links.english: "You seem angry. Why?"
links.polish: „Wygląda pani na rozgniewaną. Czemu?”
links.belarusian: "Вы выглядаеце злоснай. Чаму?"

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Look at you, you can barely walk!""
links.english: "Look at you, you can barely walk!"
links.polish: „Niech pan na siebie spojrzy! Ledwo pan chodzi!”
links.belarusian: "Паглядзіце на сябе! Вы ледзь ходзіце!"

links.title: You: ""It's nothing.""
links.english: "It's nothing."
links.polish: „To nic takiego”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта нічога."

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Doesn't look like nothing. Looks l..."
links.english: "Doesn't look like nothing. Looks like you got banged up real good."
links.polish: „Nie wygląda mi to na nic. Wygląda na to, że nieźle pan oberwał”.
links.belarusian: "Не падаецца мне гэта нічым. Выглядае на тое, што вы моцна пацярпелі".

links.title: You: ""I got shot in the foot. It was pre..."
links.english: "I got shot in the foot. It was pretty bad-ass. You would've liked it."
links.polish: „Zostałem postrzelony w nogę. Całkiem to było czadowe. Spodobałoby się pani”.
links.belarusian: "Мяне паранілі ў нагу. Гэта было даволі крута. Вам бы гэта спадабалася".

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Is this from the shooting in town?..."
links.english: "Is this from the shooting in town?" She's not letting it go that easy. "We heard gunshots. Not that we don't hear gunshots all the time, but they were closer than usual."
links.polish: „To z powodu tej strzelaniny w mieście?” – pyta, nie odpuszczając. „Słyszeliśmy wystrzały z broni palnej. Takie odgłosy to tutaj żadna nowość, ale tym razem ich źródło było bliżej niż zazwyczaj”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта з-за той страляніны ў горадзе?" – пытаецца ён, не адступаючыся. "Мы чулі выстралы з агнястрэльнай зброі. Такія гукі тут – не навіна, але гэтым разам іх крыніца была бліжэй, чым звычайна".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There was an exchange of fire on R..."
links.english: "There was an exchange of fire on Rue de Saint-Ghislaine. It's nothing to be worried about, ma'am."
links.polish: „Na Rue de Saint-Ghislaine doszło do wymiany ognia. Nie ma się czym przejmować, proszę pani”.
links.belarusian: "На Rue de Saint-Ghislaine адбылася перастрэлка. Няма з-за чаго хвалявацца, спадарыня".

links.title: Reaction Speed: "You didn't *only* get shot."
links.english: You didn't *only* get shot.
links.polish: To nie tak, że *tylko* zostałeś postrzelony.
links.belarusian: Гэта не толькі, што ты атрымаў стрэл.

links.title: You: ""I dodged the second shot. I can al..."
links.english: "I dodged the second shot. I can also get *not shot*."
links.polish: „Drugiego strzału uniknąłem. Umiem też *nie obrywać*”.
links.belarusian: "Другога стрэлу я пазбег. Таксама ўмею *не атрымліваць удараў*".

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Well, good for you." She smiles."
links.english: "Well, good for you." She smiles.
links.polish: „No cóż, gratuluję” – uśmiecha się.
links.belarusian: "Ну што ж, віншую", — усміхаецца.

links.title: You: ""I also got shot in the chest." (Po..."
links.english: "I also got shot in the chest." (Point to your chest.)
links.polish: „Postrzelili mnie też w klatkę piersiową”. (Wskaż ją).
links.belarusian: "Мяне таксама паранілі ў грудзі". (Пакажыце яе).

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""That's nothing to brag about, offi..."
links.english: "That's nothing to brag about, officer."
links.polish: „Nie ma się czym chwalić, funkcjonariuszu”.
links.belarusian: "Няма чым пахваліцца, супрацоўнік".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's not serious. He'll be okay.""
links.english: "It's not serious. He'll be okay."
links.polish: „To nic poważnego. Będzie żył”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта нічога сур'ёзнага. Ён будзе жыць".

links.title: Endurance: "You feel the ligament move on your..."
links.english: You feel the ligament move on your left shoulder. And a small, warm drip of blood. It's nothing.
links.polish: Czujesz ruch ścięgna w swoim lewym barku. I małą, ciepłą kropelkę krwi. To nic takiego.
links.belarusian: Ты адчуваеш рух сухажылля ў сваім левым плячы. І маленькую, цёплую кропельку крыві. Гэта нічога сур'ёзнага.

links.title: You: ""You should see the other guys. The..."
links.english: "You should see the other guys. They're all dead."
links.polish: „Trzeba było widzieć pozostałych. Wszyscy nie żyją”.
links.belarusian: "Трэба было бачыць астатніх. Усе загінулі".

Alternate1.english: "You should see the other guys. Two dead, one in the hospital."
Alternate1.polish: „Trzeba było widzieć pozostałych. Dwóch nie żyje, jeden jest w szpitalu”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Трэба было бачыць астатніх. Двое не жывуць, адзін у бальніцы".

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""So you're a killer." She nods sole..."
links.english: "So you're a killer." She nods solemnly. "That's good, I guess. I guess... Better than being dead."
links.polish: „Więc jest pan mordercą” – kiwa z powagą głową. „To chyba dobrze. Lepsze to... niż zginąć”.
links.belarusian: "Дык вы забойца", — сур’ёзна ківае галавой. "Гэта, напэўна, добра. Лепш гэта... чым загінуць".

links.title: You: ""Most cops are killers.""
links.english: "Most cops are killers."
links.polish: „Większość policjantów to mordercy”.
links.belarusian: "Большасць паліцэйскіх — забойцы".

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Aye, I bet they are. The good ones..."
links.english: "Aye, I bet they are. The good ones at least."
links.polish: „Tak, założę się, że nimi są. Przynajmniej ci dobrzy”.
links.belarusian: "Так, гатовы паспрачацца, што яны такія. Па меншай меры, добрыя".

links.title: You: ""I was a killer long before this ha..."
links.english: "I was a killer long before this happened."
links.polish: „Byłem mordercą na długo przed tym, jak to się stało”.
links.belarusian: "Я быў забойцам задоўга да таго, як гэта здарылася".

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Aye." She nods solemnly. "Not a lo..."
links.english: "Aye." She nods solemnly. "Not a lot of RCM men who aren't killers."
links.polish: „Tak” – kiwa z powagą głową. „Niewielu funkcjonariuszy MOR-u nie jest mordercami”.
links.belarusian: "Так," — з сур'ёзнасцю ківае галавой. "Нямногія функцыянеры РГМ не з'яўляюцца забойцамі".

links.title: Rhetoric: "She knew you were one when you took..."
links.english: She knew you were one when you took her to Land's End.
links.polish: Wiedziała, że nim jesteś, kiedy zabierałeś ją na Kraniec.
links.belarusian: Яна ведала, што ты ёсьць ім, калі ты браў яе на Край.

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Aye." She nods solemnly. "I've alw..."
links.english: "Aye." She nods solemnly. "I've always taken you for one, that's for sure. Not a lot of RCM men who aren't killers."
links.polish: „Tak” – kiwa z powagą głową. „Nigdy nie miałam co do tego wątpliwości. Niewielu funkcjonariuszy MOR-u nie jest mordercami”.
links.belarusian: "Так", — з сур'ёзнасцю ківае галавой. "Я ніколі не сумнявалася ў гэтым. Невялікая колькасць супрацоўнікаў РГМ не з'яўляюцца забойцамі".

links.title: You: ""I'm not a killer, I'm a cop.""
links.english: "I'm not a killer, I'm a cop."
links.polish: „Nie jestem mordercą, a policjantem”.
links.belarusian: "Я не забойца, а паліцэйскі".

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Aye, I guess you are." She nods. "..."
links.english: "Aye, I guess you are." She nods. "I understand that's how it goes."
links.polish: „Tak, najwyraźniej pan nim jest” – kiwa głową. „Rozumiem, że tak to wygląda”.
links.belarusian: "Так, відавочна, вы ім з'яўляецеся," — ківае галавой. "Разумею, што так гэта выглядае".

links.title: You: "Scoff in a masculine manner."
links.english: Scoff in a masculine manner.
links.polish: Prychnij po męsku.
links.belarusian: Пырхні па-мужчынску.

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: "She just looks at you, her tea-leng..."
links.english: She just looks at you, her tea-length skirt flapping in the wind.
links.polish: Tylko patrzy na ciebie, a jej spódnica sięgająca do połowy łydki powiewa na wietrze.
links.belarusian: Толькі глядзіць на цябе, а яе спадніца, якая дасягае сярэдзіны галёнкі, узмахвае на ветры.

links.title: You: ""I have a question for you." (Concl..."
links.english: "I have a question for you." (Conclude.)
links.polish: „Mam do pani pytanie”. (Zakończ).
links.belarusian: "У мяне да вас пытанне". (Скончыце).

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Of course. Can I help you with som..."
links.english: "Of course. Can I help you with something?"
links.polish: „Oczywiście. Mogę panu jakoś pomóc?”
links.belarusian: "Вядома. Ці магу я вам неяк дапамагчы?"

links.title: You: ""I'm a cop. I don't merely exist in..."
links.english: "I'm a cop. I don't merely exist in *this* world -- I live in the *between* life and death."
links.polish: „Jestem gliniarzem. Nie istnieję ot tak w *tym* świecie. Trwam *pomiędzy* życiem i śmiercią”.
links.belarusian: "Я кап. Я не існую проста так у *гэтым* свеце. Я застаюся *паміж* жыццём і смерцю".

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Everyone does that, in a way. You..."
links.english: "Everyone does that, in a way. You don't have to get shot for that." She waves her hand dismissively.
links.polish: „Tak jak wszyscy, w pewnym sensie. Nikt nie obrywa z tego powodu kulki” – stwierdza, machając lekceważąco ręką.
links.belarusian: "Так як і ўсе, у пэўным сэнсе. Ніхто не атрымлівае з-за гэтага кулі", — зазначае ён, махаючы абыякава рукой.

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""What happened to you anyway? We he..."
links.english: "What happened to you anyway? We heard gunshots from the town. They were closer than usual."
links.polish: „Co się panu właściwie stało? Słyszeliśmy odgłosy wystrzałów dochodzące od strony miasta. Ich źródło było bliżej niż zwykle”.
links.belarusian: "Што з вамі здарылася? Мы чулі гукі стрэлаў з боку горада. Іх крыніца была бліжэй, чым звычайна".

links.title: You: ""Some people hurt me.""
links.english: "Some people hurt me."
links.polish: „Pewni ludzie zrobili mi krzywdę”.
links.belarusian: "Некаторыя людзі зрабілі мне крыўду".

links.title: You: ""I wanted to talk to you about some..."
links.english: "I wanted to talk to you about something else -- your boat."
links.polish: „Chciałem porozmawiać z panią o czym innym. O pani łodzi”.
links.belarusian: "Я хацеў пагаварыць з вамі пра штосьці іншае. Пра вашу лодку".

dialogueTree.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Officer Harry, what happened? You'..."
dialogueTree.english: "Officer Harry, what happened? You're limping. Why are you limping? You look terrible."
dialogueTree.polish: „Funkcjonariuszu Harry, co się stało? Kuleje pan. Dlaczego pan kuleje? Wygląda pan paskudnie”.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Супрацоўнік Гары, што здарылася? Вы кульгаеце. Чаму вы кульгаеце? Выглядаеце жахліва".

dialogueTree.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Officer, what happened? You're wou..."
dialogueTree.english: "Officer, what happened? You're wounded. Why are you wounded? You look terrible."
dialogueTree.polish: „Funkcjonariusz, co się stało? Jest pan ranny. Dlaczego jest pan ranny? Wygląda pan paskudnie”.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Афіцэр, што здарылася? Вы паранены. Чаму вы паранены? Выглядаеце жахліва".

dialogueTree.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Officer, what happened? You're lim..."
dialogueTree.english: "Officer, what happened? You're limping. Why are you limping? You look terrible."
dialogueTree.polish: „Funkcjonariuszu, co się stało? Kuleje pan. Dlaczego pan kuleje? Wygląda pan paskudnie”.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Афіцэр, што здарылася? Вы кульгаеце. Чаму вы кульгаеце? Выглядаеце дрэнна".

dialogueTree.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""I see you haven't left our little..."
dialogueTree.english: "I see you haven't left our little Martinaise yet. Still running around," she observes. "Like some kind of cross-country law official."
dialogueTree.polish: „Widzę, że nie opuścił pan jeszcze naszego malutkiego Martinaise. Wciąż pana wszędzie pełno” – stwierdza. „Jak jakiegoś międzynarodowego przedstawiciela prawa”.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Выглядае, што вы яшчэ не пакінулі нашага маленькага Мартынаіза. Вы ўсё яшчэ ўсюды, як нейкі міжнародны прадстаўнік закона", — сцвярджае ён.

links.title: You: ""I still have a case to solve.""
links.english: "I still have a case to solve."
links.polish: „Nadal mam sprawę do rozwiązania”.
links.belarusian: "Я ўсё яшчэ маю справу, якую трэба вырашыць".

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Aye, I guess you do. What's on you..."
links.english: "Aye, I guess you do. What's on your mind, Officer Harry?"
links.polish: „Tak, pewnie tak. W czym mogę pomóc, funkcjonariuszu Harry?”
links.belarusian: "Так, напэўна так. Чым магу дапамагчы, службовец Гары?"

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Aye, I guess you do. What's on you..."
links.english: "Aye, I guess you do. What's on your mind, officer?"
links.polish: „Tak, pewnie tak. W czym mogę pomóc, funkcjonariuszu?”
links.belarusian: "Так, напэўна, так. Чым я магу дапамагчы, афіцэру?"

links.title: You: ""I have some loose ends to tie up.""
links.english: "I have some loose ends to tie up."
links.polish: „Mam kilka niedokończonych spraw do zamknięcia”.
links.belarusian: "Маюць некалькі незавершаных спраў для закрыцця".

links.title: You: ""This place is kinda growing on me,..."
links.english: "This place is kinda growing on me, you know."
links.polish: „Wie pani, zaczyna mi się tu nawet podobać”.
links.belarusian: "Ведаеце, мне тут нават пачынае падабацца".

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Aye, but don't let it grow too muc..."
links.english: "Aye, but don't let it grow too much... this is not the place to settle down. Now, what's on your mind, Officer Harry?"
links.polish: „Tak, tylko niech się pan nie przyzwyczaja za bardzo... To nie jest miejsce, w którym człowiek chciałby się osiedlić. W czym mogę pomóc, funkcjonariuszu Harry?”
links.belarusian: "Так, толькі ня няхай пан не прывыкае занадта... Гэта не тое месца, дзе чалавек хацеў бы асесці. Чым магу дапамагчы, афіцэр Гары?"

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Aye, but don't let it grow too muc..."
links.english: "Aye, but don't let it grow too much... this is not the place to settle down. Now, what's on your mind, officer?"
links.polish: „Tak, tylko niech się pan nie przyzwyczaja za bardzo... To nie jest miejsce, w którym człowiek chciałby się osiedlić. W czym mogę pomóc, funkcjonariuszu?”
links.belarusian: "Так, толькі хай пан занадта не прывыкае... Гэта не месца, дзе чалавек хацеў бы пасяліцца. Чым магу дапамагчы, афіцэру?"

dialogueTree.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Aye, officer." A woman in a rain c..."
dialogueTree.english: "Aye, officer." A woman in a rain coat stands on the quay, considering an overturned boat. A sword in a scabbard hangs from her hip.
dialogueTree.polish: „Funkcjonariuszu” – kobieta w płaszczu przeciwdeszczowym stoi na nabrzeżu, przyglądając się wywróconej dnem do góry łodzi. Przy jej biodrze wisi miecz w pochwie.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Службовец" — жанчына ў дажджавіку стаіць на набярэжнай, углядаючыся на перавернуты дном уверх лодку. Пры яе сцягне вісіць меч у похве.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "Factory balanced... bakelite and st..."
links.english: Factory balanced... bakelite and stainless steel.
links.polish: Fabrycznie wyważany... Z bakelitu i stali nierdzewnej.
links.belarusian: Заводскі збалансаваны... З бакеліту і нержавеючай сталі.

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Anything I can help you with?""
links.english: "Anything I can help you with?"
links.polish: „Mogę w czymś panu pomóc?”
links.belarusian: "Ці магу я вам чымсьці дапамагчы?"

links.title: You: ""As always, I am... the Lawbringer.""
links.english: "As always, I am... the Lawbringer."
links.polish: „Jak zawsze, jestem... Prawodawcą”.
links.belarusian: "Як заўсёды, я... Заканадаўца".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You've graduated to *Lawbringer* n..."
links.english: "You've graduated to *Lawbringer* now?"
links.polish: „Więc awansowałeś na *Prawodawcę*?”
links.belarusian: "Дык вы атрымаеце на "Заканадаўца"?"

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Men with authority have their quir..."
links.english: "Men with authority have their quirks. Comes with never being second-guessed about anything..." She waves you off.
links.polish: „Mężczyźni u władzy mają swoje dziwactwa. Wynika to z tego, że nikt nigdy nie wątpi w to, co mówią...” – macha lekceważąco ręką.
links.belarusian: "Мужчыны пры ўладзе маюць свае дзівацтвы. Гэта вынікае з таго, што ніхто ніколі не сумняваецца ў тым, што яны кажуць..." – зняважліва махае рукой.

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""So what brings you here, Lawbringe..."
links.english: "So what brings you here, Lawbringer?"
links.polish: „Więc co pana tu sprowadza, panie Prawodawco?”
links.belarusian: "Дык што прывядзе вас сюды, пане Законатворцу?"

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""Are you now?" She smirks. "There a..."
links.english: "Are you now?" She smirks. "There are a lot of lawbringers around Martinaise, but not a lot of law."
links.polish: „Czyżby?” – pyta z kpiącym uśmieszkiem. „W Martinaise mamy wielu prawodawców, ale niezbyt wiele prawa”.
links.belarusian: "Няўжо?" — пытаецца са здзеклівай усмешкай. "У Мартынеезе ў нас многа заканадаўцаў, але няшмат права".

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""I guess men with authority have th..."
links.english: "I guess men with authority have their quirks." She waves you off. "What brings you here, Lawbringer?"
links.polish: „Mężczyźni u władzy mają swoje dziwactwa” – stwierdza, machając lekceważąco ręką. „Co pana tu sprowadza, panie Prawodawco?”
links.belarusian: "Мужчыны пры ўладзе маюць свае дзівацтвы," – зазначае ён, зневажальна махаючы рукой. "Што вас сюды прывяло, спадар Заканадаўца?"

links.title: You: ""That depends. Where are we exactly?""
links.english: "That depends. Where are we exactly?"
links.polish: „To zależy. Gdzie właściwie jesteśmy?”
links.belarusian: "Гэта залежыць. Дзе ўласна мы знаходзімся?"

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""A fishing village. On the seashore..."
links.english: "A fishing village. On the seashore." She looks around. "This place doesn't really have a name. It's sometimes called... *Illisible*."
links.polish: „W rybackiej wsi. Na wybrzeżu” – stwierdza i rozgląda się. „To miejsce właściwie nie ma nazwy. Czasem mówią na nie... *Illisible*”.
links.belarusian: "У рыбацкай вёсцы. На ўзбярэжжы", — заяўляе ён і аглядаецца. "Гэтае месца фактычна не мае назвы. Часам называюць яго... *Illisible*".

links.title: You: ""Why?""
links.english: "Why?"
links.polish: „Czemu?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму?"

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""The sign on the street leading her..."
links.english: "The sign on the street leading here is *illegible*. Has been since they built this place." The wind rattles her earrings.
links.polish: „Znak na prowadzącej tu ulicy jest *nieczytelny*. Był taki już w czasie, gdy ta wieś powstała” – wyjaśnia, a wiatr podzwania jej kolczykami.
links.belarusian: "Знак на вуліцы, якая вядзе сюды, *нечытэльны*. Такім ён быў ужо тады, калі гэтая вёска ўзнікла", — тлумачыць яна, а вецер позвоньвае яе завушніцамі.

links.title: You: ""I've questions. The first is -- wh..."
links.english: "I've questions. The first is -- what's your name?" (Move on.)
links.polish: „Mam pytania. Pierwsze: jak ma pani na imię?” (Przejdź dalej).
links.belarusian: "У мяне ёсць пытанні. Першае: як вас завуць?" (Перайдзіце далей).

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""The name is Lilienne. People call..."
links.english: "The name is Lilienne. People call me Net Picker." She gestures toward the fishnets. "I think I have time for questions. And that was actually the second one."
links.polish: „Nazywam się Lilienne. Ludzie nazywają mnie wybieraczką sieci” – stwierdza, wskazując rybackie sieci. „Zdaje się, że mam chwilę, aby odpowiedzieć na kilka pytań. To pytanie było drugie, a nie pierwsze”.
links.belarusian: "Мяне завуць Ліліен. Людзі клічуць мяне выбіральніцай сетак," – адзначае яна, указваючы на рыбацкія сеткі. "Здаецца, у мяне ёсць хвіліна, каб адказаць на некалькі пытанняў. Гэтае пытанне было другім, а не першым."

links.title: Logic: "Indeed. You're always confused as t..."
links.english: Indeed. You're always confused as to your whereabouts.
links.polish: Fakt. Ciągle trudno ci się połapać w swojej własnej sytuacji.
links.belarusian: Факт. Табе ўсё яшчэ цяжка разабрацца ў сваёй уласнай сітуацыі.

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: ""The name is Lilienne. People call..."
links.english: "The name is Lilienne. People call me Net Picker." She gestures toward the fishnets. "I think I have time for questions. What are the other ones?"
links.polish: „Nazywam się Lilienne. Ludzie nazywają mnie wybieraczką sieci” – stwierdza, wskazując rybackie sieci. „Zdaje się, że mam chwilę na pytania. Jak brzmią kolejne?”
links.belarusian: "Мяне клічуць Ліліенна. Людзі называюць мяне выбіральшчыцай сеткі", — зазначае яна, паказваючы на рыбацкія сеткі. "Здаецца, у мяне ёсць хвіліна для пытанняў. Якія наступныя?"

links.title: Suggestion: "Ask her about the cool sword -- hel..."
links.english: Ask her about the cool sword -- helps to break the ice.
links.polish: Spytaj ją o ten czadowy miecz. Przełamiesz pierwsze lody.
links.belarusian: Спытай яе пра гэты класны меч. Гэта дапаможа табе пераадолець першапачатковую скаванасць.

links.title: You: ""I'm good." [Leave.]"
links.english: "I'm good." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Dziękuję”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй". [Адыдзі].
